content.user_title: Build iOS apps without Xcode using xtool
content.value_statement: Developers who need to build iOS apps on Linux or Windows face the challenge of Xcode dependency. xtool enables Xcode-free iOS development using SwiftPM. This skill provides complete guidance for project setup, app extensions, and deployment.
actual_capabilities: Create new xtool projects with proper SwiftPM structure
Configure xtool.yml files with extensions and resources
Add app extensions (widgets, share, keyboard) to iOS apps
Debug build issues and troubleshoot device connectivity
limitations: Does not install or execute xtool commands directly
Does not modify files in your project directory
Does not build or deploy apps to devices
Requires xtool CLI to be installed separately

output_examples.input: Create a new xtool project called TaskTracker with widget extension
output: 1. Package.swift - SwiftPM with library products for main app and widget
2. xtool.yml - Configuration with widget extension entry
Run 'xtool dev' to build and run on simulator

best_practices: Use .library products in Package.swift for extensions, not .executable
Place extensions in Sources/ directory, following SwiftPM conventions
Keep extension Info.plists minimal with only NSExtensionPointIdentifier
Run xtool dev to build and test before deploying to devices
anti_patterns: Using project.yml or Project.swift (xtool uses xtool.yml)
Using xtool build instead of xtool dev build
Forgetting product AND target declarations for extensions

faq.question: Does xtool replace Xcode?
faq.answer: xtool replaces Xcode for building iOS apps but you still need a Mac for certain Apple services like App Store distribution.

faq.question: What SwiftPM features are supported?
faq.answer: xtool supports standard SwiftPM packages, products, targets, and resources. Most Swift packages compile without modification.

faq.question: Can I use Xcode alongside xtool?
faq.answer: Yes, xtool dev generate-xcode-project creates an Xcode project for debugging while using xtool for builds.

faq.question: Is my data safe with xtool?
faq.answer: xtool is a local CLI tool. It does not upload your code or data to any server. Authentication uses your Apple credentials only.

faq.question: First build fails or is slow
faq.answer: This is normal on first run. xtool downloads and builds Darwin SDK modules. Wait for completion and subsequent builds will be faster.

faq.question: How does xtool compare to XcodeGen?
faq.answer: xtool uses SwiftPM directly and xtool.yml configuration. XcodeGen generates Xcode projects. xtool is designed for cross-platform iOS development without macOS.
